speaker: ABBY
text: Last season on Dance Moms...
I produce amazing, employable dancers.
I produce stars.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Abby is going to make my daughter the best she can be.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: First place...

speaker: CHRISTI
text: It's my job to make sure
all those little things are taken care of
so that she can be the star that she needs to be on stage.

speaker: KELLY
text: I'm very proud of my daughters.
A lot of the time, they don't show me that they appreciate it.

speaker: HOLLY
text: Abby can be tough.
I think she produces excellent dancers.
But she demands a lot.
Arms. Pop up. I want it strong.
Take your kid. Take your socks.
Find another school.
Your daughter is holding a national title.
And I will take it away in a minute.
Everyone's replaceable.

speaker: ABBY
text: All this training, all this competing,
is about the Nationals.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Winner, This Is My Beauty,
Abby Lee Dance Company.

speaker: ABBY
text: You are bright, shining stars.
You're my stars.
This time every girl is going to come home
with the crown on their head.
One, two, three.
We are Abby Lee.
Woo!

text: âª Get up âª

Mom's, girls, get in here.

Hello, ladies.

text: I'm going into this competition season
with a very open mind.
And I'm not going to have any negative thoughts.
I'm thinking very positive.
How's it going?
Where's Holly?
Nia, where is your mother?
She's at work.
Not going to happen.
Yes. She needs to leave work,
leave the job, forget it, and be here with you.
That's what's important.
Yes? You want this. I know you want it.
I know you love it.
She has to love it for you.

I think Nia feels badly.
So I feel bad for the kid.
And I get angry with the mother.
If you're going to do this,
and all the other mothers are there, be there.
Now, first of all, you're national champions.

That's something to be very proud of.
Then we got to LA, we did a video.
People know who you are now from watching that video.

When you walk in,
it's going to be all about beating the Abby Lee Dance Company.
Brand new season for the Abby Lee Dance Company.

everybody wants to see them fail.

Where did that get Vivi-Anne?
Nowhere.
I'm going to have an open audition.
A casting call for a new dancer
for the Abby Lee Dance Company.

text: I'm definitely nervous that there could be
more than one replacement at the audition.
I mean, my kids are always at the bottom.

for a new girl for this group,
maybe two new girls.
Everyone's replaceable.
Are you next?
Everyone's replaceable.
We know. We've heard. So are you.
First, Mackenzie.
You can't sit on the couch and eat chips.
You're not six and under.
You're seven and over.
And I expect the same thing from you
as Maddie did when she was seven.
Next, Brooke.
Brooke, why are you on the bottom of this pyramid?
You had a great season.
But then you took a break.
You didn't show up to class.
Paige, same thing.
You can't take a vacation.
New rule, dancing year-round.
Nia, you want to win a title.
It's all about a title.
Every time I talk to your mother, it gets back to the title.
Your mother couldn't care less about you winning a title.
She's not even here.
I'm the one who needs to be there all the time, not my mom.
Because she has to work and stuff.
And she's not a dancer.
Chloe, you're in the video.
âª It's like summer âª
âª It's a brand new day âª
People recognize you, wherever you go now.

text: Here's our girls with their first professional job.

And Maddie, you're on the top of the pyramid.

Maddie, Chloe, Nia,
you're going to be doing solos.
Now Maddie, it's not going to be an easy win.
It's nine and up. And you're on the young side of the age.

text: I'm really not that nervous moving up

in Greensboro, North Carolina.
And we're going to do a new number called, "Sassy Dolls".
We have one week to the competition.

We're starting from scratch, right now.
This is going to be crazy.
All right?
Moms, I'm going to dismiss you.
Girls.
We are the reigning national winners.
These girls need to keep their eyes on the title.
It's difficult to get on top and to become that winner.
But it's even tougher to stay on top.
And that's my goal for them this year.
We want to dominate at those competitions.
They are going to be the best.
They are a force to be reckoned with.
And everybody knows it.

text: I think it's going to be weird

And it was a big huge dissension
about who was always going to be at the top.
Well, we're going to do a pyramid.

Then we have Kerisa.
Then we've got Taylor.

Since Erica's doing a solo,

And you'll all have an opportunity
to be at the top of the pyramid.
Let's go. Let's get ready.
Let's do some rehearsing. Okay?
We've got talent.
And we've got heart and soul.
And we are determined that we want to make sure

Yes.

-Abby. -The kid needs somebody.

Jill.

Is the one going to come from Ohio?

-Leslie. -What?
-Calm down. -Bull crap. I do everything right.

-Leslie. -No. I'm done.

Go ahead. Go meet your friends. No, go ahead.
If you disappoint, Abby she can hold a grudge.
And she always tells us, everyone's replaceable.
Sorry.
I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
But I have to tell you that I'm not coming.
I'm trusting Nia with you.
-Wait. I know. -Okay.
So--but I know she's going to do well.
She wants to do it for the team.
So...
Abby refused to get out of the car to talk to me.
I had to talk to her through her window.
She would not give me the courtesy of having
a civilized conversation.
And she was done.

speaker: ABBY
text: Holly always has something else to do.
And I've had it with her.
It's never about Nia.
It's always about Holly.

speaker: JILL
text: Abby, Kendall and I have a little something for you,
for letting us in on your family.
I bought Abby a gift as a token of my appreciation.
And I wanted to give it to her in front of all the other moms.
Because I want them to know that I'm serious about this.

speaker: WOMAN
text: What is it? Perfume and...
Is this Chanel?

speaker: MELISSA
text: Is that the no-- That's the No. 5.
That's it.

speaker: KELLY
text: Jill pulls out a gift for Abby.
I wanted to die.
I was like, oh, my God, here's another Melissa.
(laughs) A gift giver.
-Thank you. -You're welcome.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: I would give Abby a three month trial membership
to Weight Watchers if I were to give her a gift.
It's the gift that would keep on giving.
Girls, come on. Let's go.
Here we are at Dance Troupe in Greensboro, North Carolina.
Let's go. Check it out.
And there is some amazing talent here.
I'm excited to see what's going to happen on stage.
Look at me, baby. I need you to sit up tall.
I'm going to get this done really quick. We'll start with your eyes.
All right. Now listen. You just shot the music video.
People recognize you. They know who you are.
Do not go out there and forget your dance.
Do not let it happen.
Keep dancing.

speaker: CHLOE
text: It's very hard to keep Abby out of your head.
Like when I'm at the mall, sometimes I'll hear Abby out of nowhere.
Now Kendall, remember, you are still on probation.
What you do out there today counts. Yes?
I'm not really sure what probation means.
I think she keeps saying probation just because she
wants me to bring it.
But I am prepared to go on stage and bring it.
New age group, nine and up.
Do not disappoint me.
Get out there. And do what you were trained to do.
All right. Are we ready? Game faces.

speaker: MADDIE
text: It's not hard dancing against older girls.
I'm not intimidated by anyone.
I'm not nervous at all. I'm totally confident.
And I'm ready to compete.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: Now we'd like to welcome to the stage contestant number 65.
Welcome, Maddie.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Jubilation bells âª
âª Ringing from the depths your heart and soul âª

text: I'm watching Maddie dance. And she looks good.
And her face is stunning.
She really told the story with her face.
There's this part where she does about stealing the scene.
And she really did it well.
She certainly was the star of the show.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Let yourself go âª
âª What you waiting for? âª
âª Your time is now âª
âª You need nothing more âª
âª You got love âª

text: Once again, this is contestant number 65, Maddie
from Studio Bleu.

speaker: MADDIE
text: I felt really confident with my dance.
I got a lot of applause. And I felt good.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: This was contestant number 44, Caitlin.
Up next, we have contestant number 84.
Welcome, Chloe.

text: âª I got a wish that's only mine âª

âª I'm going to wish as hard as I can âª

âª I want to tell it to the trees âª
âª I want to hear it whisper back to me âª
âª I'm going to wish as hard as I can âª
âª Well if wishes were fishes, the sea âª

speaker: CHLOE
text: When I'm on stage dancing,
it feels like what I was meant to do and what I love doing.
And it feels like I'm just being what I want to be, a dancer.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Everybody loves a dream âª
âª Everybody loves, everybody loves, everybody loves a dream âª
âª Everybody loves a dream âª

speaker: ABBY
text: Chloe was good. She was confident.
But there's a big turn section that she does.
And she goes to the floor.
And she wasn't spotting the right direction.
She could have done it better.
But she covered it.

speaker: NIA
text: I was very nervous before I got on stage.
It was really scary.
Because my mom wasn't there.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: Next is contestant number 85.
Welcome to the stage, Nia for One Small Girl.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Da da da da da dum âª
âª Da da da da da da dum âª
âª There's a little girl inside my mind âª
âª A tiny little angel from a magic time âª
âª And this one girl leads my world âª
âª In colors of wonder âª
âª And this one girl âª
âª Nails my heart in sunshine âª
âª In splendor âª
You were amazing. You were.
...so good.
I think I did pretty well when I got off stage.
I thought it was like the best solo I'd ever done.
Yay.
No mommy and you did it.
The kid looked beautiful.
I was proud that she stayed on the music.
She covered the ending. She did a nice job.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: Up next, we have contestant number 81
in the performance of Bring on the Boys from Studio code 513.
Welcome, Kendall.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª That little boys âª
âª Bring out the girl in me âª
âª You know those boys âª
âª Bring out the woman in me âª
âª Those little boys... âª
The way that Jill was talking, I expected Kendall to be this amazing dancer.
She was a good dancer.
But no comparison to Maddie or Chloe.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª ...bring out the sugar in me âª
âª So let's... âª

speaker: KENDALL
text: Before I went on stage,
I was hearing Abby's voice telling me all the corrections
and all the changes.
But I know I can do this.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª 'Cause girls rule the world âª
âª That regal king bring out the tigress in me âª
âª So let's enjoy one another âª

speaker: ABBY
text: Kendall looked gorgeous in her costume.
But the face wasn't there.
The kid was a nervous wreck.
-Were you nervous? -Sort of.
Okay.

speaker: JILL
text: Kendall was really nervous at the competition.
Here she's known these girls for three days.
She gets a new solo.
She really wants to do well for Abby.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: Are we ready for awards?
-(applause) -Are you sure?

speaker: ANNOUNCER 3
text: This is Performance.
In fourth place, number 85...
we have One Small Girl as the title.
It's Abby Lee Dance Company.
I think that's correct.

speaker: NIA
text: I got fourth place in my category.
And I'm really happy for that.
Things ended up okay without mom.

speaker: CHLOE
text: I really hope I win first. I don't want to let my fans down.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 3
text: And in first place Junior Age Division,
our Overall Award goes to number 84, Born to Sing,
Abby Lee Dance Company.

speaker: CHLOE
text: In my age category, I got first overall.
And I was really excited and happy.
Because it's the first solo of the new dance season.
And it just felt really good to start off on a good note.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 3
text: And rounding out our Pre-Junior Category,
in first place, number 65, Star of the Show,
Abby Lee Dance Company.

speaker: MADDIE
text: Chloe and I had a very high score on our solo.
And we beat some 16-year-olds.
And I thought that was a very good achievement for us two.
We need to get ready for the group dance.
Let's go.
Kendall, you need to watch your distended neck.
You need to pull it back.
I just want to know what your thoughts were on Kendall.
I don't know.
With that probation thing, I don't want you to like hold her
on that one performance, when she had three days to learn
-the number. -This is what this is all about.
If she passed that test, I guess that's my question.
I don't want to be on probation.
I want to be part of the team.
I want my daughter to be a part of the team.
I want to get rid of this probation crap and move on.
I said she has to prove herself.
And she's going to keep on proving herself.
Everything is going to be a test.

speaker: KENDALL
text: I'm sort of sad.
I think I'm going to be on probation for pretty long.
-Okay? -I wasn't prepared.
No. You were prepared honey.
You had...a couple days to prepare.
-ABBY: Kendall. Are you crying? -JILL: No.

speaker: ABBY
text: No tears.
You save those tears for your pillow, in your room, alone.
You're going to humiliate yourself in front of everyone in this dressing room.
-Do not cry. -JILL: It's okay.
Suck it up, kid. You're here.
You're healthy. You are one lucky little girl.
Act like it.
What I saw from Kendall disappointed me.
She didn't blow me out of the water.
I was expecting this kid to come out there
and have the whole package.
And she didn't. So she's still on probation.

speaker: JILL
text: Okay.

speaker: ABBY
text: All right, girls. Listen to me.
Everybody can dance better.
You know, this was the first time out.
It was the first competition of the new season.
You're a little rusty out there.
All of you are too old to be cute, even Mackenzie.
The girls did great on their solos.
But now it's time for the group number.
And we all know it's a lot harder to dance together
as a group than it is to dance alone by yourself.

speaker: ABBY
text: Girls, this is the first time you've been on stage
since the big national win.
Do you understand that?
You can't go from up here to down here in one performance.
Guys, you're next. We need you. Let's go.

speaker: BROOKE
text: I think there's a lot of pressure on me and the other girls.
Because we just won a national title.
So we need to keep winning to win another national title.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
text: Next up, we have set 189,
with a performance of Sassy Dolls.
Please welcome studio competition code 513.

text: âª Oh âª
âª Oh âª
âª I'm a sassy girl âª

text: I'm happy to be in the group dance this week.
For this number, I'm stuck in a box.
And I can't get out.
I finally get out of the box when the girls come up
and find me and get me out of the box.

text: âª I'm a sassy girl âª

speaker: ABBY
text: They looked great.
They danced so so.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 3
text: Overall high scores.
In the Pre-Junior Age Division, third place trophy,
number 193 Freak, Floyd Ward School of Dance.

speaker: PAIGE
text: Altogether I think we did a really good job.
Because everyone was really acting like a doll.
So I think we did good.

speaker: ANNOUNCER 3
text: Second place, number 198,
How Great Thou Art, Floyd Ward's School of Dance.
Rounding out the Juniors, number 189,
Sassy Girls, Abby Lee Dance Company.

speaker: ABBY
text: I guess cute still works in North Carolina.
Because they won.
Is it good enough for me? No.
Is it ever going to be good enough for me?
Probably not.
Girls, you have to get it together.
I said no more sloppy groups.
And you know what? Brooke, you're too old to be cute.
You're right in the front, before the whole side area section,
looking across at Chloe to see what to do.
I was just a little bit nervous that I was on the wrong count.
Every once in a while, I would look out at Chloe.

speaker: ABBY
text: Nia, you were not even dancing.
You didn't even know where you were on stage.
You don't want a group dance?
We can just come and do the solos.
It'll save a lot of rehearsal time if we don't need a group.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Abby comes in. And she reams out our girls
for being sloppy on stage.
And the number wins first place.
Back to the drawing board.
New number, starting tomorrow.

speaker: KELLY
text: You're the one that wants them to learn
a new dance every three days.
Everybody else out there, I can guarantee you,
have been doing their numbers more than three days.
How come I'm the only one that gets aggravated?
Because you're the only one that hasn't had a child.
No. But I had a mother and a father.
And if they looked at me one time, I knew.
One look.
So I'm telling you right now, it's 4:30 to 9:30,
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday.
Plan on it.
I'm allowed to say the routine wasn't good.
Most parents value my opinion more than the three judges.
Whatever, Abby.
I was so frustrated.
I'm just not the kind of person that's gonna sit back and shut up.
-No... -I don't have to pay on time.
I'm Kelly Hyland. I've been dancing for 30 years.

speaker: KELLY
text: I always paid the whole year up front.
Because I'll show you my Discover card payment
that shows for the past 10 years, I've paid you in full.
You're the reason I don't even take Discover any more.
Kelly, go get a job.

speaker: KELLY
text: Oh, don't even go there, you whore.
Oh, you are a whore.
So welcome, Jill.
-Yeah. Sorry -Welcome.

speaker: JILL
text: Kendall has never experienced that kind of behavior from adults.
And I don't know why they let it get to that level.
Does that happen like all the time?
It does.
Why do they get that heated? Why does it go so far?
I mean, my God, name-calling.
Don't ever trust Kelly or Christi.
They'll stab you in the back as quickly as they can.
They do it to me all the time.

speaker: JILL
text: These moms are crazy.
If they ever pull that stuff on me,
they're going to see a whole other side of Jill.
It seems like the only person I can connect with right now
is Melissa. I think I can trust her.
If they ever come after me like that, verbally.
I'll stick up for you.
-Please help me out. -Okay.
-I will. -I might need that.
-Well, thank you. -JILL: You're welcome.

speaker: ABBY
text: This season on Dance Moms.
Suck it up. I don't want to see those tears.
We are headed to Columbus, Ohio.
You know who lives in Ohio?
Candy Apple's.

speaker: ABBY
text: This season Abby's taking the gloves off.
(scream) What is it? Let me see.
Oh, no.
-WOMAN: A freaking apple. -(laughter)
You need to take your cheap dress...
My dress is not cheap.
Be gone witch. You have no powers here.

speaker: ABBY
text: I can't win with these moms. It's going to get worse.
I really don't care.
Payton deserves that spot before Kendall.
She's bigger than that part.

speaker: ABBY
text: You have a solo coming up.
-Let's pull it. -Move along.
-You guys never support Maddie. -Because it's obvious Maddie does great.
I just don't know why I let my kids do this.
Sick of these (bleep) (bleep)
Was it good?
